intro: Cerastium ramosissimum, commonly known as hairy mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from April to May. Its leaves are hairy and oval-shaped, often arranged in a rosette at the base. Cerastium ramosissimum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
